title.value: Moleculuar Geometry Pretraining with SE(3)-Invariant Denoising Distance Matching
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning of the document followed by the abstract.
title.quote: MOLECULAR GEOMETRY PRETRAINING WITH SE(3)-INVARIANT DENOISING DISTANCE MATCHING

extractions.description: This paper presents GeoSSL, a 3D coordinate denoising pretraining framework that captures the energy landscape of 3D molecules using SE(3)-invariant score matching method. The resulting method, GeoSSL-DDM, focuses on denoising pairwise atomic distances and is validated through comprehensive experiments on 22 downstream tasks, outperforming existing baselines.

type.justification: This paper validates its proposed methods through comprehensive experiments, empirically demonstrating its effectiveness and robustness on 22 different downstream tasks.
type.quote: Our comprehensive experiments confirm the effectiveness and robustness of our proposed method.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on molecular representation pretraining, which is a significant aspect of computational chemistry.
name.quote: Molecular representation pretraining is critical in various applications for drug and material discovery due to the limited number of labeled molecules.

name.justification: The paper introduces GeoSSL, a self-supervised learning framework designed for 3D molecular geometry data.
name.quote: Further by leveraging an SE(3)-invariant score matching method, we propose GeoSSL-DDM in which the coordinate denoising proxy task is effectively boiled down to denoising the pairwise atomic distances in a molecule.

name.justification: The paper employs Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) to model the molecular structures.
name.quote: Recent work based on graph neural networks (GNNs) has shown superior performance thanks to the simplicity and effectiveness of GNNs in modeling graph-structured data.

name.justification: The key methodological contribution of the paper is the application of denoising score matching in the SE(3)-invariant GeoSSL framework.
name.quote: This approach has been further improved by combining SM with denoising auto-encoding, forming the promising denoising score matching (DSM) strategy.

name.justification: The paper introduces GeoSSL as the main framework for 3D coordinate denoising pretraining to model the molecular energy landscape.
name.quote: To achieve the aforementioned goal, we first introduce a general geometric self-supervised learning framework called GeoSSL.

is_contributed.justification: It is one of the major contributions of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We first introduce a general geometric self-supervised learning framework called GeoSSL.

is_executed.justification: The paper performs experiments to validate GeoSSL.
is_executed.quote: Examples of these frameworks include our proposed GeoSSL framework and the specifically designed GeoSSL-DDM.

is_compared.justification: GeoSSL is compared against other methods in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We empirically verified the effectiveness and robustness of GeoSSL-DDM on 22 downstream tasks.

referenced_paper_title.justification: GeoSSL is a newly introduced model in this paper, not referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We propose GeoSSL, a 3D coordinate denoising pretraining framework to model such an energy landscape.

name.justification: The paper presents GeoSSL-DDM as the implementation of GeoSSL using SE(3)-invariant score matching to denoise pairwise atomic distances.
name.quote: Based on this, we further propose an SE(3)-invariant denoising distance matching pretraining algorithm, GeoSSL-DDM.

is_contributed.justification: GeoSSL-DDM is a core contribution and implementation of the GeoSSL framework discussed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We further propose an SE(3)-invariant denoising distance matching pretraining algorithm, GeoSSL-DDM.

is_executed.justification: The experiments conducted in the paper include the validation of GeoSSL-DDM.
is_executed.quote: Moreover, directly denoising such noisy coordinates remains challenging... we further leverage an SE(3)-invariant score matching method, GeoSSL-DDM.

is_compared.justification: GeoSSL-DDM is evaluated against other baselines in the experiments section.
is_compared.quote: We empirically demonstrate the effectiveness and robustness of GeoSSL-DDM on 22 downstream tasks.

referenced_paper_title.justification: GeoSSL-DDM is a novel model introduced in this paper and is not derived from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We empirically demonstrate the effectiveness and robustness of GeoSSL-DDM on 22 downstream tasks.

name.justification: QM9 is one of the datasets used in the downstream tasks to validate the proposed models.
name.quote: We list the benchmark results on QM9 in Table 4.

referenced_paper_title.value: Quantum chemistry structures and properties of 134 kilo molecules
referenced_paper_title.justification: QM9 dataset is referenced in the context of the experiments, and its properties are described.
referenced_paper_title.quote: QM9 [46] is a dataset of 134K molecules consisting of 9 heavy atoms. It includes 12 tasks that are related to the quantum properties.

name.justification: MD17 is another dataset used for downstream testing of the proposed methodologies.
name.quote: MD17 [10] is a dataset on molecular dynamics simulation. It includes eight tasks, corresponding to eight organic molecules, and each task includes the molecule positions along the potential energy surface (PES).

referenced_paper_title.value: Machine learning of accurate energy-conserving molecular force fields
referenced_paper_title.justification: MD17 is cited in the paper with relevant reference details.
referenced_paper_title.quote: MD17 [10] is a dataset on molecular dynamics simulation.

name.justification: The paper uses a subset of 1M molecules with 3D geometries from Molecule3D derived from PubChemQC for pretraining.
name.quote: For our molecular geometry pretraining, we take a subset of 1M molecules with 3D geometries from Molecule3D.

referenced_paper_title.justification: PubChemQC dataset is used in the context of the experiments but not derived from another specific paper referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The PubChemQC database is a large-scale database with around 4M molecules with 3D geometries.

name.justification: The pretraining dataset Molecule3D, derived from PubChemQC, is used.
name.quote: For our molecular geometry pretraining, we take a subset of 1M molecules with 3D geometries from Molecule3D.

referenced_paper_title.value: Molecule3D: A benchmark for predicting 3D geometries from molecular graphs
referenced_paper_title.justification: Molecule3D is properly cited in the context of describing the pretraining datasets.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Molecule3D [73] takes the ground-state geometries from PubChemQC and transforms the data formats into a deep learning-friendly way.

name.justification: LBA is used to predict the binding affinity strength between a small molecule and a protein pocket.
name.quote: We select three evaluation metrics for LBA: the root mean squared error (RMSD), the Pearson correlation (Rp ) and the Spearman correlation (RS ).

referenced_paper_title.value: The PDBbind database: methodologies and updates
referenced_paper_title.justification: The LBA dataset is referenced with relevant citation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The first task is ligand binding affinity (LBA). It is gathered from [70] and the task is to predict the binding affinity strength between a small molecule and a protein pocket.

name.justification: LEP is used to detect if the same molecule has a higher binding affinity with one pocket compared to another.
name.quote: For the LEP task, the supervised and two contrastive learning pretraining baselines stand out for both ROC and PR metrics.

referenced_paper_title.value: Atom3D: Tasks on molecules in three dimensions
referenced_paper_title.justification: LEP dataset is cited in the experiments section, describing its relevance and application.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We follow Atom3D in data preprocessing and data splitting.
